did.abstract: The Harry and Mae Millstone Papers contain records of Mae Kaplan Millstone (1913-2009) and Harry Millstone (1907-1999), labor activists and organizers. Mae Kaplan Millstone and Harry Millstone met in Detroit while organizing with the C.I.O. and later married in 1938. The collection includes documentation of their work as organizers and activists in the 1970s and 1980s. Also included is a variety of subject files regarding women's history, and women in the workplace. Mae Millstone was the editor of the women's pages of the Gazette and Daily newspaper of York, Pennsylvania in the 1960s. Included in the collection are women's pages from the Gazette and Daily dating from 1962-1965, 1967, 1970 and 1971.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Harry and Mae Millstone, the creators of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2009. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Harry Millstone sent a gift of his and his wife Mae Millstone's papers in 2009. The accession number associated with this gift is 2009.077.
